title: Blackpool Spending: Year-by-Year Trends and What They Reveal
summary: Blackpool Council's spending decreased by £79.1M (45.2%) from 2019 to 2026, with a total spend of £4068.9M across 630,914 transactions.
author: Blackpool Council Transparency

title: Red Flags in Blackpool's Spending: What DOGE Analysis Found
summary: The total spend analysed by AI DOGE is £4068.9M across 630,914 transactions.
author: Blackpool Council Transparency

title: Inside Blackpool's Departments: Where Every Pound Goes
summary: Blackpool Council's total spend analysed is £4068.9M across 7 financial years.
author: Blackpool Council Transparency

title: Blackpool Council: £4.1 Billion Across 630,914 Transactions
summary: England's most deprived seaside authority has processed £4.1 billion in payments to 9,846 suppliers since 2019. Low duplicate rates but £342.5 million in round-number payments raise questions about estimation practices.
author: Blackpool Council Transparency

title: Blackpool's £342.5 Million Round-Number Problem
summary: 5,331 payments over £5,000 in round figures totalling £342.5 million — the most striking finding in Blackpool's DOGE analysis. Strong duplicate controls but concerning estimation patterns across seven years of data.
author: Blackpool Council Transparency
